body_html:
Hey @tfboyd,
Thank you for commenting on both my posts. I was unaware of the tf_cnn_benchmark_MKL.py script maybe because the master branch is 1 commit away from the MKL branch.
I would like to know

what value can I set for the num_inter_threads and num_intra_threads flags on the tf_cnn_benchmark_MKL.py script depending on the Knight Landing with 288 logical cores?

I am aware that intel published the article with the updated wheel a few days ago, I think the article should point to the MKL branch on github, so that people know that the new version of the script is out.

Thank you @reedwm for pointing him to this post.

Regards,
Krishna

body:
Hey @tfboyd,
Thank you for commenting on both my posts. I was unaware of the tf_cnn_benchmark_MKL.py script maybe because the master branch is 1 commit away from the MKL branch. 
I would like to know 

> **what value can I set for the num_inter_threads and num_intra_threads flags on the tf_cnn_benchmark_MKL.py script depending on the Knight Landing with 288 logical cores?**

 
I am aware that intel published the article with the updated wheel a few days ago, I think the article should point to the MKL branch on github, so that people know that the new version of the script is out.

Thank you @reedwm for pointing him to this post.

Regards,
Krishna
